p: The total flavonoid contents of B. pilosa and E. crus-galli were assessed by a colorimetric assay as described previously [ 53]. Briefly, a volume of either 100 µL sample (1 mg/mL) or standard (5–25 µg/mL) was mixed with 100 µL aluminum (III) chloride hexahydrate (2% w/ v in water) in a 96-wells-microplate. After a 15-min incubation at room temperature, the absorbance of the reaction mixture was measured at 430 nm using a microplate reader. The total flavonoid contents were expressed as mg quercetin equivalent (QE) per gram of fresh weight (r 2 = 0.999).
